items: Find a set of parallel bars that are sturdy and can support your weight.
Stand between the bars and place your hands on each bar, with your palms facing inward.
Jump up and straighten your arms, so that your body is suspended between the bars.
Bend your elbows and lower your body down towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Lower your body until your shoulders are below your elbows.
Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Targets multiple muscle groups including chest, triceps, shoulders, and core
Improves upper body strength and stability
Increases range of motion in shoulders and elbows
Can be modified for different fitness levels by adjusting the height of the rings or using assistance bands
Engages stabilizer muscles in the shoulders and core for improved overall strength and balance
Chest muscles (pectoralis major and minor)
Triceps brachii
Anterior deltoids
Core muscles (rectus abdominis, obliques)
Assisted Ring Dips
Weighted Ring Dips
Strict Ring Dips
Kipping Ring Dips
Ring Dip Negatives
Ring Dip Holds
Ring Muscle-Ups
